title: Exceptional
comment: Very good keyboard. I like how there is a settings menu, caps button, and a send button for letters. Some apps have you wait for a letter to be sent, which makes morse input slow and no fun. Its also not clunky like other morse keyboards like with vibrate feedback.

title: Inefficient
comment: You have to press the space key to confirm each letter that you type

title: Best morse keyboard
comment: I think this is the best Morse keyboard I've found, works great. Just to ask, making it better, could it be possible to make it Holo? It's a simple app and I don't think it would be so difficult to improve it, because looks a bit old, anyway, works amazing and it's the best of its kind.

title: Good but
comment: It would be nice if it had auto correct

title: BEST
comment: good and better then the traditional keyboard

title: Eprox
comment: bagus untuk mengusung kepraktisan tapi masih ada kekurangan yaitu untuk tombol symbol tidak ada di tampilan pada hal itu juga penting

title: True Touch-typing
comment: Expect 20 wpm with practice. But beyond handwriting speed it hardly matters: the advantages are touch-typing and composition without text prediction, and Dotdash has no competitors. Absurd as it may seem, I'm on year two, and I cannot give up those features.
Nice way to learn Morse!

title: Good
comment: Five stars because it does what it says. However some suggestions would be to add a sound for button presses. Also I would recommend adding a physical "enter" key, but that's just me. By the way I typed this with Morse code.

title: Good but couldn't find the previews of dots n dashes... plz see to it
comment: Couldn't find t preview of dots n dashes.. that is making the typing hard .. and plz add a settings key too.. bcz evrytime i want to change the keyboard (QWERTY) i have to go to settings all over again.. where as other keyboard apps include the settings key to the space bar.    Using ICS but looks like the bugs r hone but problem a raised plz look to it...

title: Great app! But...
comment: Haptic and sound feedback please. long time no update!

title: Needs to add a sidetone
comment: It's very hard to send Morse code accurately without sidetone

title: Good
comment: Dot dash keyboard. Letters arent entered until you hit space. This makes it easier for slower coders like me, but might get in the way of faster coders.  The good: Optional Morse code for new line. Big buttons. No permissions other than keyboard. The bad: No ref sheet.
You should be able to see the Morse code reference sheet by swiping up, off of the keyboard.
Extra keypress for each character?
crap -.-

title: No cheat sheet? :/
comment: Swiping up no longer opens up the cheat sheet for me, and that sucks cause my morse is weak
This should be fixed with version 1.1.6.
Always force closes. Never got to use it.

title: Clean but annoying space
comment: Ive tried many morse keyboards and this is not bad. It has a nice clean design but the constant space tapping drives me mad. di da di da return is clever. Lacks minimize.
learned morse code in an hour, wrote this with morse code. it is faster than a 0-9 mobile phone keyboard, but obviously not faster than full a-z ...

title: Great !!
comment: Great keyboard but I can't seem to swipe up to get the cheat sheet!
This should be fixed as of version 1.1.6.

title: HTC One X
comment: I can't access the cheat sheet whyyy :(
Great

title: BEST!
comment: better than any keyboard

title: My answer to touch keyboards
comment: I've been searching for a keyboard that is easy to use, fixes the "fat finger syndrome" and I can type without looking (used to be able to do that on my blackberry tactile keyboard).  I tried all the other apps on the market and this is, hands down, the best one available.  Never new Morse code with the exception of S.O.S. but now I've been forced to learn the alphabet (I'm still having memory issues with a couple letters :)  I'm really looking forward to more improvements and would gladly pay a donation if made available.

title: Love it!
comment: I'll admit I was a little skeptical when I saw that you had to make that extra tap for each and every letter. But I must say that it is probably it's greatest feature! It means that now you don't have to worry about trying to catch-up with your wpm and you can easily fix things like a capital letter with a single tap! Btw love the new cheat sheet! ;P

title: punctuation
comment: Hi there  Up to yesterday .-.-.. was a carriage return, today is nothing. Please, make it work again. It was my favourite morse keyboard and I want it  to be again. A settings option maybe would be great.  Thanks for this programme, The best around so far.

You should be able to change this from the keyboard's settings menu. In earlier versions of the app this setting may have been lost during upgrades, but that issue has been resolved in newer releases.

title: This is the best one out there.
comment: Just takes a little getting used to.

title: best one
comment: tried most of the ones on the market, this is by far the easiest to use :) please release a straight key update soon, thanks for the awesome app!

title: Great, a reference page would be nice though
comment: A way to access a reference sheet from the keyboard, like you click a button that has a (i) symbol and it takes you to a quick popup of a reference ageet for morse code woyld be great for us beginers
You can access the cheat sheet by swiping up off of the keyboard.

title: Simple. Practical. Love it.
comment: I found this because of Google's little joke. I'm glad you went ahead and put it out there. I like it better than the others. Cheers. Keep up the good work.

title: 17 year old
comment: Thanks I will be busy all holiday learning morse

title: Great app!
comment: Works perfect!
